* The ClearCommand class handles clearing all tasks from the task list.
* It calls the appropriate method in Storage to remove all tasks and prints a confirmation message.
* Executes the clear command by clearing all tasks from storage.
* After clearing the tasks, it prints a message indicating that the task list is empty.

* The Command class is an abstract class that represents a command issued by the user.
* Each command must define its own execute method, which operates on the provided Storage.
* Executes the command with the given storage. Each subclass of Command
* must implement this method to define the behavior of the command.
* @param storage The storage object that the command will interact with.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the command is invalid or cannot be executed properly.
public abstract void execute(Storage storage) throws InvalidCommandException;

* JeM is the main class for the JeM chatbot application.
* It initializes the necessary components (Ui, Storage, and Parser)
* and handles the main loop of the application, processing user inputs
* until the chatbot is instructed to exit.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting the user's input
* and returning the appropriate Command object. It ensures that user
* input is correctly matched to known commands and throws an exception
* Parses the user input and maps it to the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The input provided by the user.
* @param storage The storage object that handles task data management.
* @return The corresponding Command object based on the user input.
* @throws InvalidCommandException If the input does not match a known command.
public Command parse(String userInput, Storage storage) throws InvalidCommandException {
* The Ui class handles all interactions with the user.
* It reads user input, displays welcome and exit messages,
* and manages the interface of the JeM chatbot.
scanner = new Scanner(System.in);  // Set up the scanner to read user input
return scanner.nextLine().trim();  // Read and return user input
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println(" Hello! I'm JeM, Your e-Assistant");
System.out.println(" Just type out your tasks you have to complete and I will make a list of them for you.");
System.out.println(" For tasks with no deadline, type todo <task name>, for tasks with deadlines, type deadline <task name> /by <date and time>");
System.out.println(" For events, type event <task name> /from <date and time> /to <date and time>");
System.out.println(" Type 'list' to see the current list of tasks,'delete <task number>' to delete that task");
System.out.println(" Finally, type 'bye' to end the chat!");

* The Deadline class represents a task that has a specific deadline.
* It extends the Task class, adding a deadline date and time.
* This class includes methods for retrieving the deadline and formatting
* the task for file storage and display.
* The Event class represents a task that occurs during a specific time period.
* It extends the Task class and adds start and end times to the task.
* This class provides methods to retrieve the start and end times, as well as
* to format the task for file storage.
public Event(String task, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
return ("E | " + (getIsDone() ? "+" : "-") + " | " + getTask() + " | from " + start.format(fileFormatter) + " to " + end.format(fileFormatter));
* The Task class represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* It provides methods to retrieve the task details, mark the task as done or not done,
* and convert the task into a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The Todo class represents a simple task without any specific deadline or event time.
* It extends the Task class and only requires a task description.
